intro: Acrostichum proximum, commonly known as the dwarf fern, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its small, compact growth habit. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Its botanical structure includes a rhizomatous stem and fertile spore-bearing structures on the underside of its fronds.
